metadata.title: Standard ways of evaluating these cases still depend heavily on clinical skill, which isn’t always consistent. Mistakes in reading the signs aren’t rare. Now, with advancements in Artificial Intelligence, the field is shifting. It’s not just about detection anymore. AI enters the scene

abstract.first_50_chars: Background: Dental caries, being among the most fr
abstract.last_50_chars: al Radiographs. Int J Dent Mater. 2025;7(2):37-46.

figures.label: Figure 1
figures.caption: Diagram showing the steps in processing 400 periapical images through a Fiji-powered ResNet model for interproximal

figures.label: Figure 2
figures.caption: A bar graph compares caries diagnosis by three radiologists across 900 posterior teeth

figures.label: Figure 3
figures.caption: A line graph comparing detection rates of interproximal caries by class (I to III) between radiologists and the AI model

figures.label: Figure 4
figures.caption: ROC curves demonstrating AI performance in detecting interproximal caries from periapical radiographs
